title: Breakthrough Deal Aims to End Gaza Conflict; Troops Withdrawal Planned
snippets: The deal raises the possibility that the war may now be over, ending the  bloodiest fighting ever between Israelis and Palestinians.
Mediator Qatar said that more details of the agreement would be announced at a later date.
US President Donald Trump said this means that all of the hostages will be released very soon and Israel will withdraw troops. DW has the latest.
President Donald Trump said earlier Wednesday he may go to the Middle East in the coming days.
US president says all hostages to be released ‘very soon’ as he hails breakthrough deal

Donald Trump announces that all hostages will be released ‘very soon’ and Israel will withdraw troops to an agreed upon line

  • Follow latest upd
'This means that ALL of the Hostages will be released very soon, and Israel will withdraw their Troops to an agreed upon line,' Trump wrote on his Truth Social website.
President Donald Trump suggested he may travel to Gaza.

U.S. President Donald Trump has announced that Israel and Hamas have agreed to the “first phase” of his peace plan to pause fighting and release at least some hostages and prisoners. “This means that ALL of the Hostages will be released very soon, and Israel will withdraw their Troops to an agreed u
A senior Hamas official said late Wednesday that an agreement to end the war in Gaza was “imminent.”
titles: Israel and Hamas agree on the 'first phase' of Gaza ceasefire deal
Trump says Israel and Hamas sign off on first phase of Gaza ceasefire plan
Israel, Hamas sign off on phase 1 of Gaza plan, Trump says
Israel-Gaza live updates: Trump says Israel and Hamas signed off on 1st phase of deal
Trump says Israel and Hamas have agreed first phase of Gaza peace plan
‘First phase’ of ceasefire deal to end war in Gaza agreed by Israel and Hamas
Trump says Israel, Hamas agree to 1st phase of Gaza peace plan
Trump Says Israel And Hamas Have Agreed To First Phase Of Peace Deal
Israel and Hamas agree to ‘first phase’ of plan to end fighting and release hostages, Trump says
Trump, Hamas officials say Gaza ceasefire deal ‘very close’
summary: A breakthrough deal has been announced, potentially ending the war in Gaza, marking the cessation of the bloodiest fighting between Israelis and Palestinians. Qatar, acting as mediator, confirmed details will follow. U.S. President Donald Trump stated all hostages will be released imminently, and Israel will withdraw troops to a specified line. Trump also hinted at a possible visit to the Middle East soon. This agreement represents the "first phase" of a peace plan, with a senior Hamas official indicating an end to the conflict is "imminent."

summary: Jack Eichel has agreed to an eight-year contract extension with the Vegas Golden Knights, worth $108 million. This deal, averaging $13.5 million annually, ensures Eichel won't become a free agent in 2026.

title: IRS Furloughs Workers Amid Ongoing Government Shutdown
snippets: The IRS furloughs came on the same day that the Senate again fell short of passing a funding resolution that would end the federal government shutdown.

Move comes after White House memo suggests workers may not get back pay, despite law Trump signed in first term

The Internal Revenue Service said it will furlough nearly half of its employees – about 34,000 workers – due to the government shutdown, making it significantly harder for US taxp
Tax filings and payments are still due and Criminal Investigation will stay on the job. But processing of refunds and amended returns will likely be delayed.
The Senate failed Wednesday to approve spending plans to reopen the government.
titles: IRS furloughs nearly half of its workforce due to government shutdown
IRS to furlough nearly half its workforce due to government shutdown
IRS Halts Most Taxpayer Services As It Furloughs Nearly Half Its Workers
IRS Furloughs Nearly Half Of Its Staff Amid Government Shutdown: Here’s What’s Impacted
summary: The IRS furloughed employees as the Senate failed to pass a funding resolution, continuing the federal government shutdown. Despite efforts, no spending plans were approved to reopen the government. President Trump previously stated that about 750,000 federal workers could be furloughed or fired due to the shutdown.

title: Man Arrested for Historic LA Fire, AI Image Found on Devices
snippets: Investigators say evidence collected from the 29-year-old's devices showed an AI image of a burning city.
Police say 29-year-old Jonathan Rinderknecht was behind fire that destroyed much of the Pacific Palisades neighbourhood.

Authorities announced the arrest of a 29-year-old man for allegedly starting the devastating fire in the Los Angeles neighborhood of Pacific Palisades in January. It is considered the worst fire in the city's history.
titles: ChatGPT image snares suspect in deadly Los Angeles fire
Suspect charged with starting deadly Los Angeles Palisades fire
US police arrest man suspected of starting deadly LA fire
summary: Jonathan Rinderknecht, 29, was arrested for starting a fire in Los Angeles' Pacific Palisades neighborhood, considered the worst in the city's history. Evidence from his devices included an AI image of a burning city.

title: Flight Delays Rise Amid Controller Shortage and Government Shutdown

Flight delays and cancellations are climbing as sick calls involving air traffic controllers leave a number of airport towers and control facilities without enough staff to handle all flights.
The government shutdown is exacerbating concerns about the strain on air traffic controllers, a shortage of whom has vexed airline executives for years.
titles: How air traffic controllers could help end the shutdown - Axios

summary: Flight delays and cancellations are increasing due to a shortage of air traffic controllers caused by sickness-related absences. The ongoing government shutdown is worsening the situation, highlighting a long-standing issue of controller shortages that has troubled airline executives for years.

title: Attack on Manchester Synagogue on Holy Day Kills Two; Assailant Claims IS Ties
snippets: Police confirm the attacker made the call after he crashed his car into a brick wall.
Police said Jihad al-Shamie called emergency services to declare allegiance to armed group as he carried out the attack.
Jihad al-Shamie, who attacked a Manchester synagogue on the holiest day of the Jewish calendar, called the emergency services during the attack to claim responsibility.
titles: Synagogue attacker pledged allegiance to 'Islamic State' in 999 call
Manchester synagogue attacker claimed allegiance to ISIS, UK police say
Manchester Synagogue Attacker Pledged Allegiance to ISIS, Police Say
summary: Jihad al-Shamie attacked a Manchester synagogue on the Jewish calendar's holiest day, killing two worshippers. During the attack, he crashed his car into a brick wall, then called emergency services to claim responsibility and pledge allegiance to the Islamic State, according to police.

title: Tuchel Calls England 2026 World Cup "Underdogs," Stresses Unity and Cohesion
snippets: Thomas Tuchel believes England will go into the World Cup as "underdogs" and says they have "no chance" of succeeding unless the team unite.
The 2026 FIFA World Cup is set to be the most expensive, polluting and political yet.

Thomas Tuchel has said England would be underdogs at the World Cup and would be stronger if they did not allow themselves to become burdened by expect

Will the 2026 World Cup be a disaster for fans?
Tuchel insists England should embrace underdog status at 2026 World Cup
summary: Thomas Tuchel, addressing England's prospects for the 2026 FIFA World Cup, labeled the team as "underdogs" and emphasized the necessity of unity for any chance of success. He highlighted the importance of not overburdening themselves with expectations. Additionally, Tuchel mentioned his approach to team selection, focusing on cohesion over merely gathering the most talented players. The 2026 World Cup is noted for being anticipated as the most expensive, environmentally taxing, and politically charged iteration to date.

title: France's PM Lecornu: Budget Must Pass by Year-End, Avoids Snap Elections
snippets: Sébastien Lecornu, the outgoing prime minister, said MPs recognise the pressing need to pass a budget by the end of the year.
The announcement came after last-ditch talks by outgoing premier Sebastien Lecornu failed to find a solution to crisis.
The announcement from the French president came after last-ditch talks held by Sébastien Lecornu, France’s departing prime minister, who said most parties wanted to avoid snap elections.

summary: Sébastien Lecornu, France's outgoing prime minister, announced the need to pass a budget by year's end, following unsuccessful last-ditch talks to resolve a crisis. Despite the failure, Lecornu noted a general consensus among parties to avoid snap elections, as stated by the French president.

title: Man United Co-owner Backs Coach Amorim, Offers 3-Year Window to Prove Worth
snippets: Manchester United co-owner Sir Jim Ratcliffe says manager Ruben Amorim needs three years to prove he is a "great" coach.

• Minority owner moves to clarify coach’s future

  • ‘You can’t run a club like United on kneejerk reactions’

Sir Jim Ratcliffe insists he will not take a “kneejerk” decision to sack Ruben Amorim and has indicated he will afford the head coach three years to demon
Manchester United minority owner Sir Jim Ratcliffe has said he wants to give under-pressure head coach Ruben Amorim three years in the job to prove himself.
titles: Amorim needs three years at Man Utd - Ratcliffe
Ratcliffe says Ruben Amorim has three years to prove himself at Manchester United
Ratcliffe: I want to give Amorim three years to prove himself at Man Utd
summary: Manchester United co-owner Sir Jim Ratcliffe supports head coach Ruben Amorim, stating he will not make a "kneejerk" decision regarding his position. Ratcliffe emphasizes the importance of stability and has indicated Amorim will be given three years to demonstrate his capabilities and prove he is a "great" coach for the club.

title: EU Parliament Bans Meat Terms for Plant-Based Products Amid Criticism
snippets: Pressure to ban meat labels for plant-based products comes from Europe's livestock farmers.

Proponents say move would strengthen position of farmers in supply chain but critics dismiss it as ‘hotdog populism’

Veggie burgers, tofu steak and cauliflower schnitzel will be off the menu if the European parliament gets its way after a vote on food names.

MEPs voted on Wednesday by
More and more European shoppers are buying imitation schnitzel, bratwurst and steak made from plants but some politicians say only real meat should use those names.
titles: No more veggie burgers? EU parliament votes to ban meat names for plant-based foods
‘Veggie burgers’ could be off EU menu as MEPs back renaming plant-based foods
That’s no schnitzel! E.U. moves to ban using meat names for veggie fare.
summary: European Parliament voted to restrict plant-based products from using meat-related terms like 'burger' or 'steak'. This decision, supported by livestock farmers aiming to strengthen their market position, faces criticism for potentially misleading consumers and limiting choice. Critics label it as 'hotdog populism'. The outcome impacts labeling of plant-based foods across Europe, with opponents arguing it could confuse shoppers accustomed to such terms for vegetarian options.

Flintoff felt undervalued by the terms proposed, leading to his decision to step down. Teammate Adil Rashid expressed surprise and disappointment at Flintoff's departure.

title: Spain Passes Law Enforcing Arms Embargo Against Israel
snippets: The vote, which passes 178 votes to 169, enshrines into law an embargo that has been in effect since the war began.
Spanish lawmakers have passed a law ending all trade of arms, defence equipment, or technologies to Israel.

Decree bans all exports of defence equipment, products or technology to Israel and imports of such goods from Israel

Spain’s parliament has voted to enshrine in law an arms embargo on Israel that the prime minister, Pedro Sánchez, introduced to end “the genocide in Gaza”.

Parliament b
titles: Spain’s parliament formally approves Israel arms embargo

summary: Spanish lawmakers have passed a law, with a vote of 178 to 169, officially enshrining an arms embargo against Israel. This legislation bans all exports and imports of defense equipment, products, or technology to and from Israel, aiming to end what Prime Minister Pedro Sánchez described as "the genocide in Gaza."

title: Tigers Rally to Beat Mariners 9-3, Force Decisive ALDS Game 5
snippets: The Detroit Tigers' All-Stars stepped up when they were needed the most.  Facing elimination and trailing the Seattle Mariners 3-0 in Game 4 of the American League Division Series on Wednesday, the Tigers' slumbering bats finally regained their thump and forced a winner-take-all Game 5 on Friday in

Riley Greene and Javier Báez homered in a four-run sixth inning and the Detroit Tigers kept their season alive with a 9-3 win over the Seattle Mariners in Game 4 of the American League Division Series.
titles: Tigers' All-Stars come through in 9-3 win over Mariners and force a Game 5 in ALDS
Tigers rally to beat Mariners, force decisive Game 5 in AL Division Series
summary: The Detroit Tigers overcame a 3-0 deficit against the Seattle Mariners in Game 4 of the American League Division Series, winning 9-3. Key players Riley Greene and Javier Báez hit home runs during a four-run sixth inning, reviving the team's offense. This victory forces a decisive Game 5, keeping the Tigers' season alive.

title: Fed Officials Split on Rate Cuts Amid Inflation Concerns

summary: Minutes from the US Federal Reserve's September meeting revealed that some officials were hesitant about the recent decision to cut rates, due to ongoing concerns about inflation. Despite this, new projections indicated that the Fed anticipates two more quarter-point rate reductions by the end of the year.

title: 2025 Nobel in Chemistry for Pioneers of Pollution-Fighting Frameworks
snippets: The work that won Susumu Kitagawa, Richard Robson and Omar M. Yaghi the 2025 Nobel Prize in chemistry could help tackle challenges such as climate change and lack of fresh water.
Three researchers share prize for structured polymers called metal-organic frameworks.
titles: Trio wins chemistry Nobel Prize for metal organic framework
Chemistry Nobel prize awarded for building ordered polymers with metal
summary: Susumu Kitagawa, Richard Robson, and Omar M. Yaghi were awarded the 2025 Nobel Prize in Chemistry for their development of metal–organic frameworks. These structures are capable of capturing carbon dioxide, storing toxic gases, catalyzing chemical reactions, and harvesting water from desert air. Their groundbreaking work offers potential solutions to global challenges like climate change and water scarcity.

title: Amazon Pharmacy Launches Medication Kiosks for Common Prescriptions
snippets: The kiosks are operated by Amazon Pharmacy and stock a range of commonly prescribed medications, such as antibiotics, inhalers and blood pressure treatments.
The kiosks have a range of commonly prescribed medications, including antibiotics, inhalers, and blood pressure medications.

summary: Amazon Pharmacy operates kiosks stocking various commonly prescribed medications like antibiotics, inhalers, and blood pressure treatments. The kiosks provide convenient access to these medications for customers.

title: Nobel Chemistry Prize Awarded for Metal-Organic Frameworks Innovation
snippets: Susumu Kitagawa, Richard Robson and Omar Yaghi have been honoured for the development of metal-organic frameworks, porous materials that can capture water or pollutants
Three scientists have been awarded the 2025 Nobel prize in chemistry for discovering a new form of molecular architecture: crystals that contain large cavities.
titles: Nobel prize in chemistry awarded for work on molecular architecture
Nobel chemistry prize awarded for crystal materials that could revolutionize green technology
summary: Susumu Kitagawa, Richard Robson, and Omar Yaghi were awarded the Nobel Prize in Chemistry for creating metal-organic frameworks. These innovative porous materials have applications ranging from capturing water in deserts to storing gases and delivering drugs. This recognition highlights their significant contribution to science and various industries.

title: Prime Big Deal Days End with Discounts on Tech and Budget Items
snippets: Prime Big Deal Days is well into its second and final day, and big-ticket tech like Sony’s Bravia 8 OLED TV and Bose’s QuietComfort headphones are still some of the more marquee deals that caught our eye. However, you don’t need to spend hundreds (or thousands) of dollars to score something great. I

Day two of Prime Big Deal Days is in full swing, and while there are still plenty of big-ticket discounts lining the digital shelves of Amazon, not everyone is looking to shell out a bunch of cash (myself included). The good news is you don’t have to spend a fortune to score a great deal, […]
titles: These 63 October Prime Day deals under $50 are still available

summary: Prime Big Deal Days has entered its final day with significant discounts on high-end items like Sony's Bravia 8 OLED TV and Bose’s QuietComfort headphones. Despite the focus on expensive technology, there are also numerous deals available for shoppers on a budget, emphasizing that great deals are accessible without spending a lot of money.
